text: Through the window of a Land Rover, we see a construction site working at full capacity. Huge arc lights and floodlights illuminate the scene and men are hard at work A group of men are in discussion in a pool of light. Ther is a conversation, then one of the men breaks off and tak call on his cellphone. He is distant, not even the focal point of the shot. He puts his finger in his ear to hear call more clearly. He is too far away for us to see his reactions or expression but, when he cuts the call, he wa directly toward the car and the other men turn to watch h go. As he gets closer we see he wears a tie and heavy boots a heavy coat. He wears a hard hat. He finds a key fob and hits it. The lights inside the car glow in response. The man gets into the driver’s seat. He is in his thirtie a face made of stone and unused to expressions of emotion This is IVAN LOCKE. He sits in the driver’s seat for a few moments. He takes breath and we might guess (or we might not) that he has j had some important news. Is he scared, angry? He takes out his cellphone and looks, deciding whether or to make a call. He checks his watch. He decides there isn time for the call. He puts the phone away quickly and fir the engine. He shifts gear and reverses. We stay with him and will st with him intensely for the rest of the story. The car bumps over rough ground as Ivan heads for the big secure gates that open out onto the street. The construct site is massive and it takes a while to reach the edge of Trucks rumble and generators roar. This is Ivan’s world. The gates are opened by a guy in a high viz jacket. Ivan reaches the kerb of the road and indicates right as a ref But he doesn’t pull away. He realizes that this time he must choose which way he wi go. He has a decision to make but he is a man who makes a hundred hard decisions a day. Even so, he takes time. A massive truck pulls up inches behind him and its headli fill Ivan’s car. Ivan continues to make his decision as h indicator ticks away the seconds. The truck hoots its baleful horn, the voice of fate. Ivan hits the indicator to indicate left instead of right He turns left and joins light evening traffic.  Locke - Shooting Script - Feb 21st 2013 3.
We see Ivan pulling out of the site through the lens of a CCTV camera...

Ivan will now drive through city streets toward the M6 motorway, a couple of miles away. We will not blink as we study him as he drives... Ivan is now confronting the crisis in his head. On the si he was in a familiar place but now he is on a journey and must necessarily begin to consider the destination and th place he is leaving. His first decision is to make a phone call on his hands f car phone. This is an important component of the story so should take some time establishing the mechanism. He has long list of speed dial numbers, identified by names or locations. He speed dials a number labelled ‘Bastard’...

Hello, can I speak to Gareth? We hear a woman’s voice from the hands-free phone. Many voices will come into the car during this story. The firs is a woman in her forties (GARETH’S WIFE)... GARETH’S WIFE (OOV) He’s not back yet. Can I ask who’s calling?
Ivan Locke. GARETH’S WIFE (OOV) Can I say what it’s regarding?
Concrete. Ivan takes a moment and decides an explanation would be pointless...
Can you tell him it’s urgent and tell him to call me back. GARETH’S WIFE (OOV) Does he have your number?

Yes.  Locke - Shooting Script - Feb 21st 2013 4. We hear children in the background and a TV. Ivan reacts the family sounds because the world of children and famil about to explode and he will be cut adrift from it foreve GARETH’S WIFE (OOV) What was your name again?
Ivan Locke. GARETH’S WIFE (OOV) Something about concrete.
Yes. GARETH’S WIFE (OOV) Will he know what?
No. Something has come up. I need to tell people... Ivan almost chokes on some unexpected emotion. It is a sh to us and to him, like undigested food hitting his gullet
It’s urgent. A dog barks. GARETH’S WIFE (OOV) What?

I said it’s very urgent. Thanks. He cuts the call and drives. The emotion that just struck him was a bad development so early. He has a lot to do in the next hour and a half and he must hold this together a all costs. He drives for a while to calm himself. Then, when he is sure he is ready, he makes another call... We hear a mobile phone answer message. The voice is BETHA early thirties... BETHAN’S ANSWER MESSAGE (OOV) Hi, this is Bethan. I can’t get to the phone right now, please leave a message. Ivan misses the cue of the beep by a second because he’s getting his voice straight. Finally...
It’s Ivan. I got your messages. I’m on my way and I’‘1l get there. I’m in the car now. (MORE)
Locke - Shooting Script - Feb 21st 2013 5

It’ll be about an hour and a half unless there’s traffic. He takes a moment... IVAN LOCKE (CONT’D) It’ll be ok. If the nurses or anybody wants to talk to me I’m only on this number. Or if the doctors or anybody. It’1ll be ok. I‘ll get there. The traffic should be ok. He cuts the call. He drives and twenty seconds later his phone rings... IVAN LOCKE (CONT’D) Ivan Locke. We hear a soft Southern Irish accent... A pause. A pause.
I just got your message. It’s a joke, is it?
I know it’s a shock but it will be ok?
Ok?
I will go through everything with you and it’1ll be ok.
You know where I am? I’m ata service station. I’m turning the fucking van round. I put the other lads out on the hard shoulder. I was halfway home.
Yeah.
What the fuck happened?
It's a family thing.
Is someone...  He pauses. Locke - Shooting Script - Feb 21st 2013 6.
Is it a bereavement?
I don’t have a choice...
Is it one of the kids?

Donal, I need you to just fix this up and be alright... IVAN LOCKE (CONT’D) And solid. Which you are. Which you are. Just from when the sun comes up tomorrow morning until when it’s all been pumped. I need you to hold it together. You won’t be alone. I can be on the phone. I‘1l talk to you every five minutes until the pump is finished...
On the fucking phone?
On the phone.
Have you gone mad?
I don’t think so.

Ivan, at 5.45am tomorrow morning we have three hundred and fifty metric tons of wet concrete being delivered to our site. We have two hundred trucks from all over the fucking country descending on us...
Three hundred and fifty five metric tons, two hundred and eighteen trucks. A disbelieving pause. A pause.
It's a joke. Is it?  Locke - Shooting Script - Feb 21st 2013 7
I have no choice.
Is it a bereavement? Ivan never lies. Silence. A long pause.
Ivan, what the fuck has happened?
I need you to just do this. A long pause.

Ivan, I hate myself even hearing myself even saying this, but if someone’s died like your mother or someone, could you not go wherever you have to go after twelve tomorrow when the concrete is pumped? Ivan drives...
You know what I’m saying. Whoever is dead is not...you know...they won't be any different between now and midday. Dead people stay the same.
No one is dead. Donal, I need you to do this, ok? I need you to be there with enough stuff and the right heads when the sun comes up.
Holy fucking Mary. I’m a fucking concrete farmer. Did you ever see me read anything written down on paper.
You’re ok. You know how to run a pump, you know how to run trucks back-to-back and turn trucks back, you know how to test for slumps.
I’ve never even shovelled on a pump this big...  Locke - Shooting Script - Feb 21st 2013 8
It’s the same but more of it. You just do the same but for longer. Check it, slump it, send it back if it’s piss and pump it if its right. A long pause.
What did Gareth say?
I haven’t spoken to him yet.
He’1ll fucking...
I know...
He’ll go fucking sideways and around the houses like his arse is on fire.
I know.
Ivan, it’1ll be the sack.
I know.
Jesus, you’re the best foreman I ever fucking worked with and the best site manager. What the hell is it that’1ll make you risk the sack?

I need you to do this for me Donal. Start rounding up some cowboys then call me back. I'’11 be on the road. He cuts the call. Ivan is a strong practical man and he i facing a crisis which is unfamiliar, but some things he c keep control of. Men like Donal he can handle. He drives some more but ten seconds later the phone rings...
Ivan Locke.
Ivan?  Locke - Shooting Script - Feb 21st 2013 9
Where are you? When Bethan speaks she sounds scared to death and in pain She’s mid-forties, middle class...
I just got admitted. I’m in the labor ward. It’s called Bailey ward.
Did they say how long?
I'm five centimetres.
What does that mean?
Dilated.
I know but what does that mean? How long?
They just left me. I’m on my own.
Is there a bell?
A what?
I don’t know, a buzzer or something to get a nurse.
They just put their head round. They said it could be hours. A pause.
Are you ok?
I need the lavatory...
Tell them. Tell them.
There’s no one here.  He stops. A pause. Locke - Shooting Script - Feb 21st 2013 10.
Is there a bell?
They don’t have bells. What do you mean?
When they put their head round the door, tell them you need the lavatory.
It’s like a pain I’ve never had. Right inside all the way up to my chest.
Have you talked to anyone about pain?
What do you mean?
Stopping the pain. Have you decided.
They said ‘let’s see’.
Just have whatever there is. Seriously.
What?
I don’t know. For the pain. Because fuck...
You were there when your wife gave birth.
Don’t think about that, get them to give you everything. If they ask, just say I want everything.
What did she have?  Locke - Shooting Script - Feb 21st 2013 11. A pause.
Who?
Your precious wife. A pause.
I can’t remember. The thing they put in your spine. A pause.
Were you there?
Yes.
And you'll be here...
Yes.
Because I’m really in pain... She begins to cry. Ivan drives on through the night.
The traffic’s ok. Just tell them to give you everything for the pain. I‘ll be there in an hour and a half. If anything happens, just shout as loud as you can.
It’s cold and all the windows are open.
Tell them to close the windows. The traffic’s ok. Go to the lavatory. I'll be there. She begins to sob and we hear a whimper of pain.
(CONT'D)
Fuck. A pause.  Locke - Shooting Script - Feb 21st 2013 12.
Have you even told your wife that someone is having your baby? He drives....
I’m about to do that. I have a list of things I have to do tonight while I’m driving.
So I’m on a list.
Yes. Tonight, yes. A pause.
Do you love me? A long pause.

That’s a question you’re asking probably because of the pain or something. How could I love you? The call is cut. Ivan drives on. He speaks softly to himself as he glances in the rear view mirror and sees hi own eyes... IVAN LOCKE (CONT’D) So. Hell. He must concentrate on the road. He flicks through his sp dial numbers and finds ‘HOME’. He is about to call but th phone rings.... IVAN LOCKE (CONT’D) Ivan Locke.
It’s Gareth. I spoke to Donal. This had better be more than good.
Hello Gareth...
Speak to me only about the morning. It is apparent Gareth has already heard the news but Ivan confirms.  Locke - Shooting Script - Feb 21st 2013 13.
I won’t be on site for the pump tomorrow.
This is not happening.
The truth is tonight I’m going to become a father. A long pause. IVAN LOCKE (CONT’D) She’s in London. I have to be there.

Ok, ok, ok, let me read you something. Ivan. Are you listening? Yeah? Good. It’s from Mr Dean in Chicago. ‘Good luck tomorrow with the pour. We have just had it confirmed by CGO that this will be the biggest single concrete pour ever made in Europe outside of nuclear/military projects. I know the day is in the safest of hands. Best wishes, Mitchell.’ That’s Mitchell Dean himself. The President of the whole fucking company. Did you hear that Ivan? From Chicago. USA.
Yes.
You’1l have to speak up.
Yes, I heard.
And you're the man in charge of the entire operation but, with ten hours to go, you've decided you won't be there.
Donal will handle it. He is a good man.
Don’t you fucking dare say that to me. (MORE)
Locke - Shooting Script - Feb 21st 2013 14.
Don’t fucking dare to give qualitative appraisals of my staff and say ‘good man’ like it’s going off to buy a fucking ice cream. Ivan drives. A pause...
This is fucking concrete. Like shit. Like piss when it comes, you pump it.
Like babies.
It's a joke to you.
No. Right now nothing is a joke anymore.
So it’s not your wife giving birth?
No it’s someone else.
Jesus. Ivan? You are the last person on earth...
Yes. I am the last person on earth. But it happened.
And this woman can’t give birth on her own?
I've made a decision. There is nobody else who could be with her. She has no friends in London and is a quite fragile person.
Fragile? Ivan drives...
You’re going to abandon the biggest fucking concrete pour in Europe to hold someone’s fucking hand because she’s fragile.  Locke - Shooting Script - Feb 21st 2013 15.

And because the baby was caused by me. That is the decision I have made. I have not behaved in the right way with this woman. At all. I have behaved in a way that isn’t like me. But now I am going to do the right thing.
And Chicago can go to fucking hell.
It is the decision I have made. I’m not going to turn back.
Jesus, Jesus, Jesus. You know how many million pounds are riding on tomorrow?... Ivan drives...

If any one of those pumps fucks up we are facing ten million pounds worth of losses in fifteen minutes. So we get that every fifteen minutes for the whole morning, a total shut down, hundred million dollars. Pumping the hard stuff into soft ground and watching it set so we have to pay another fucking gang of fucking Hungarian monkeys to dig it out again. Secondary cost, outside insurance, another five million. Ivan drives.
Are you still there?

Yes. I have no explanation apart from the one I have given. I must do the right thing by this woman. A pause. Gareth is about to speak... IVAN LOCKE (CONT’D) But, Gareth, I have made a pledge to myself that I will not allow the pour to fuck up.
This is a joke. Are you wearing a fucking red nose?  Locke - Shooting Script - Feb 21st 2013 16. Silence.
This is a fucking joke. I’m going to call Chicago. If it weren’t for the fact that you’ve been so solid for us for so many years I would fire you down the phone. Ivan drives...
But I will speak to Chicago first. Silence...
Ivan? Have you lost your fucking mind? Ivan checks his rear view mirror.

I made my decision. The call is cut. Ivan drives on as he considers the question. Has he lost his mind? We come close to his face as he considers his situation. Then he glances in the rear view mirror. We sense that something in the mirror bothers him, an irritant he tries ignore but finally can’t. He snaps into the rear view mirror... IVAN LOCKE (CONT’D) What the fuck are you looking at? A pause. IVAN LOCKE (CONT’D) You’re watching this aren’t you. Laughing at my predicament? A familiar predicament to a man like you, right dad? A pause. IVAN LOCKE (CONT’D) You think ‘there he is, look. Like father like son. The man I made’. A pause. IVAN LOCKE (CONT’D) What is it they say? The apple doesn’t fall far from the tree. Well that’s where you’re wrong.  Locke - Shooting Script - Feb 21st 2013 16A. He studies the road, the lights flashing across his face.  Locke - Shooting Script - Feb 21st 2013 17. Ivan erupts slowly... IVAN LOCKE (CONT’D) You listen to me you fucking piece of worthless shit. I want you to watch... A pause. His face harder and harder... IVAN LOCKE (CONT’D) In fact I’d like to take a fucking shovel and dig you up out of the fucking ground and make you watch me tonight. He stares into the mirror. IVAN LOCKE (CONT’D) I'd pull open your eyes and kick the mud and worms and shit out your ears. Just for the duration of this fucking journey. Because it’s me driving not you. He drives on but his face fixes with determination.... IVAN LOCKE (CONT’D) And unlike you I‘’1ll go to the place where I should be and I’11 be there to take care of my fuck up. I’11 take what’s due to me. He glares into the rear view mirror... IVAN LOCKE (CONT’D) So you laugh or do what the fuck you want, like you always do, but I’ll fix this. Pause. IVAN LOCKE (CONT’D) I’ll fix it. His phone rings. He glances at the ghost of his father wi venom. IVAN LOCKE (CONT’D) Yes Donal.
Ok, I’m driving back so I’1l be quick. I called Ryan and stole a half dozen Poles and some Hungarians from Patrick. (MORE)
Locke - Shooting Script - Feb 21st 2013 17A.

I got breakfast tickets for the concrete farmers and the shutter boys are done bar the fucking about with clips. I asked Albanian Alby to test the pumps on the Argylle side and he said they’re pissing it out.

Ok, ok stop. When you get back on site you check every pump yourself, individually and with your own hand on the turner. You don’t ask anybody else to check and sign off. You go around the whole site and you check each one yourself. And don’t trust Alby after five because he drinks. Now. Talk to me about the mix.
Did we say C6? Ivan reacts...
Don’t say that like it’s a question.  Locke - Shooting Script - Feb 21st 2013 18.
Sometimes when I say things it sounds like a question when it isn’t.

All the mixes for this pump will be C6. Why do you even ask? It’s written on the whiteboard in fucking giant letters. I put ‘C6’ all over the cabin in big red letters. Slump of one inch, Cé. Don’t ask me questions like that...
It wasn’t a question. I know you don’t like questions.
What time are you unlocking?
I’m going to sleep here tonight.
Good. Except, don’t sleep. Check everything. You’ve got the client sign-off.
Yeah. And the client sign-off on the gates.
That’s what I mean. The gate sign off. Donal, the construction sign off should already be filed.
Yeah. It’s ok. That’s what I meant. Ivan reacts....

Ok, you have the phone numbers of the plants. Call them now Donal. Call every one of the bastards and get them to repeat the order. C6 on the nose or we send the trucks back. Seriously. Those bastards will fuck you up with water in the gulleys if it rains tomorrow.
It won’t rain. It’s going to be dry.  Locke - Shooting Script - Feb 21st 2013 19. A pause. Donal chuckles...
I have a direct line to God, up in heaven, you know?
You don’t trust God when it comes to concrete. Call the plants, Donal. Every one of them and get them to fax the order back so you can check it.
I will. Did you speak to Gareth yet?

Yes. He’s calling Chicago. I’m guessing Chicago is going to fire me and he’1l put some fucking kid on it. So don’t take his calls. Don’t listen to anybody else. Until the morning this is me and you, ok? Ivan cuts the call. He drives. He stares into the rear vi (From now, his looks into the rear view are looks into th past, looks at his father, proving he is going to do the right thing.) After forty seconds he again brings up his speed dial numbers. He shuffles through to the word ‘HOME’. He steel himself. He hits the button and the phone begins to ring. At this moment, his car joins the motorway...
From a high gantry we see Ivan’s car joining the stream o other cars heading South. He is just a man in a bubble of light, no different to all the other drivers on their own journeys....
Ivan hears the call being taken. It is a boy, fourteen ye old (EDDIE)
Hello. This was the last thing Ivan wanted, to hear his son’s vo He takes a second...  Locke - Shooting Script - Feb 21st 2013 20.
Eddie, it’s your dad. Is your mother there?
She’s not back from the shops yet... A pause...
She’s getting your beer for the match...
I won’t be back for that.
What?
Something came up. Silence. IVAN LOCKE (CONT’D) I can’t get out of it...
I’m wearing the shirt. Mum’s getting sausages and guess what? She’s wearing the shirt as well. It’s so embarrassing. What did you say about coming back?
I won’t be back for the match. A long pause. IVAN LOCKE (CONT’D) I‘1l listen on the radio. A disbelieving silence...
What do you mean? It’s rubbish on the radio. You said you'd be back. She’s doing sausages. Ivan almost chokes on emotion but holds it together.
Is your brother there?
Yeah. You want a word?  Locke - Shooting Script - Feb 21st 2013 21. Ivan decides he can’t face it. A pause.
No. Just tell your mother to call me when she gets back.
Ok.
I love you.
What?

It’s ok. Get her to call me. He cuts the call. He drives on. The motorway is busy with trucks, lit up in the darkness. He takes a moment then fi Bethan’s name on his speed dial. Ivan cuts Bethan. BETHAN’S ANSWER MESSAGE (OOV) Hello, this is Bethan, I’m afraid I can’t get to the phone... the call. He drives. Then the phone rings. It is
Did you call?
Are you ok?
Someone closed the windows.
Did you talk to anyone about pain?
No. No one’s been in.
But is everything alright?
No. It hurts like nothing ever.
I’m on the M6. Hour and a quarter if the traffic stays ok. Speak to someone about pain.  Locke - Shooting Script - Feb 21st 2013 22.
Just now I felt like I hate you.
We don’t know each other, Bethan. That’s the simple truth. This thing just happened...
This ‘thing’...
++.SO we can’t love or hate each other. This thing happened and that’s it. It will go up and down. But I’m coming at least.
Do you hate me? For going through with it?
I don’t know you so I don’t hate you. Do what they tell you to do. I have a lot of calls to make. The traffic is fine so it’ll be ok.
Please be quick.

Yes, but there’s a limit. He cuts the call and drives. He suddenly beats the steeri wheel with the side of his fist hard, a sudden explosion fury. Then he gets hold of himself. The phone rings. He sees the number... IVAN LOCKE (CONT’D) Hello Gareth.
Yeah, look. Chicago is having a predictable melt down.
It is. Ok.
I gave them the whole ten year thing. About your ten years working for Park without a foot wrong...
Nine years....  A pause. Locke - Shooting Script - Feb 21st 2013 23.
...-The whole thing. He said he goes on emotion. He said the stuff about the biggest pour in Europe...
Outside nuclear and military...
Well, I tell you what, you’re fired is what it is. They said they had no choice. I said about the ten years. But they said they had no choice. Ivan drives on.
So. Ok.
I never do this on the phone.
It’s ok. I will still make sure the pour is alright.
Ivan, this isn’t a matter for negotiation. They’ve decided. You're fired completely as of right this second.
I know, and I don’t blame them. But I’m not trying to keep my job. I just want the pour to go ok tomorrow...
Ivan...

Listen to me. I want the pour to go ok not because of the money... He takes a moment... IVAN LOCKE (CONT’D) I want it to go right for myself and for the building. And for the concrete. I won’t let it be pumped into the wrong place. Tonight and tomorrow I will stay on this and stay on this and make sure the concrete gets poured right.  Locke - Shooting Script - Feb 21st 2013 24.
Ivan, look, I told them about the ten years...
Fuck ten years. The concrete will come and I will take care of it. I know I don’t have a job anymore but I will do this anyway as a favor to the building and to the concrete.
Ivan you sound...different.
I am the same. A pause.
You should have just said you were sick...
I’m not sick. And I will make sure the pour is ok.

Ivan, I’ve already handed this over to another construction director and he will pick it up from... Ivan cuts the call. He drives on, speeds up. The phone rings. The word ‘HOME’ appears. It’s his wife KATRINA.
From surveillance cameras we see Ivan’s car driving in th fast lane. We hear his phone ringing and hear him answer.
Hello, love.
Hello Katrina...
Ivan stares ahead as he drives fast.

I got you six of the German lagers and I got sausages. I thought we could have hot dogs again. And guess what? I’m wearing the shirt.  A pause. A pause. A pause. Silence. A pause. Locke - Shooting Script - Feb 21st 2013 25.
Did Eddie not give you the message.
What message?
I’m not coming home.
What?
What do you mean? It’s the match. I’m wearing the shirt.
Which phone are you on?
What do you mean?
I can hear the TV. Could you take this call on the phone upstairs.
Upstairs? Why?
I have something... IVAN LOCKE (CONT’D) I have something to say.
Can’t it wait until you get home?
I won’t be home. We hear the boys and the TV in the background.
What’s happened?
Will you go to the phone in the bedroom?  Locke - Shooting Script - Feb 21st 2013 26.
What’s happened?
Go to the phone in the bedroom and I’1l tell you what’s happened. The line crackles and we hear Katrina call out...
Sean, when I shout put the phone down. We hear her walk away, hear the sound of the TV, preparat for a big football match. Ivan hears his two sons arguing Eddie comes to the phone...
Dad, are you coming back?
Eddie, I’m talking to your mother...
He’s not picked any wingers...
Hello.
Eddie, will you put the phone down please?
I can’t believe the team he’s picked, dad.
Please put the phone down. Eddie puts the phone down. A pause...
So what is it? A long pause.

Last year. The job in Croydon. I was up and down there for three months, remember? A pause. IVAN LOCKE (CONT’D) I stayed in that guest house. The one I said had bad damp.  A pause. A pause. A pause. Silence... Silence. Silence. Locke - Shooting Script - Feb 21st 2013 27. IVAN LOCKE (CONT’D) They gave me an assistant. She worked with me on the block construction.
‘she’?
She was a secretary. Quite old. We worked together...
Oh.
She is quite old and lives on her own. Forty three or something.
Why are you telling me about some woman? Ivan glances in the rear view mirror...

This is the only time I ever did this, Katrina. The only time. After the block was settled in, there were some drinks to celebrate. The block going in is a big thing because it is the base of the whole building... IVAN LOCKE (CONT’D) And she came back to the guest house. She isn’t what you would call an oil painting. But it was wet and cold. She talked about being lonely and I talked about being happy but lonely sometimes when I was away. And there was this wine. And this was the only time I did this in all our fifteen years. IVAN LOCKE (CONT’D) And now, tonight, she is giving birth.  Locke - Shooting Script - Feb 21st 2013 28. IVAN LOCKE (CONT’D) Tonight she is giving birth. And it’s mine. The call is cut. Ivan drives on. We stay with Ivan for a minutes as he drives. He is not a man accustomed to momen like this and his reaction is just the blue glistening ti an iceberg. He looks like a man made of ice in the headlights. The phone rings. Ivan forces himself to answer because he knows he must. IVAN LOCKE (CONT’D) Donal.
Look, Ivan, this isn’t a question, ok? Ivan waits.
But I just got off the phone with the plant in Stafford and they said they know it’s a C6 mix, but how far toward C5 can it go. Silence. Ivan is expressionless...
In other words, if one truck has some C5, how badly would that be taken? Ivan lets the silence express his disbelief...
Ivan, are you still there?
Donal, what does it say on the whiteboard?
It says C6.
What does it say on every piece of paperwork and every sign off sheet?
It says C6.

It says C6. And you know why? A pause.  A pause... Silence. A pause. Locke - Shooting Script - Feb 21st 2013 29. IVAN LOCKE (CONT’D) Because, eventually, when my building is complete, it will be fifty five floors high. It will weigh two million two hundred and twenty three thousand metric tons. My building will alter the water table and squeeze granite. Now... IVAN LOCKE (CONT’D) ...If the concrete at the base of my building is not right, if it slips a half inch, cracks appear. If cracks appear they will grow and grow and the whole thing will collapse.
Ivan, look....
You make one mistake, Donal. One, little fucking mistake, and the world comes down around you. So... IVAN LOCKE (CONT’D) Tell Stafford... IVAN LOCKE (CONT’D) Ccé.
cé6 it is. Ivan cuts the call. We drive with him for one minute as h contemplates his own mistake. He calls up the number of ‘Home’ again.
Katrina...
That didn’t happen. I’m not believing it...
Katrina, I want to move to a practical next step...
I’m here in the dark in our bedroom and nothing looks the same...  Locke - Shooting Script - Feb 21st 2013 30.

I can’t talk very well. I have felt scraped out for months. She phoned and said she was having a baby and keeping it because it was her last chance to be happy. And then tonight she phoned and said the waters broke and it’s two months early. I was going to tell you before but the waters broke early. So I have to do this now in the car.
